description:
In the year 1333, the Kamakura shogunate government comes crumbling down. A trusted vassal, Ashikaga Takauji, betrays the shogunate and organizes a rebellion. Houjou Tokiyuki, the rightful heir, escapes the massacre with a Shinto priest named Suwa Yorishige to Kamakura. On the run and fighting to stay alive, Tokiyuki sets in motion his plan to reclaim his birthright.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: นายน้อยจอมโกยก้าวสู่เส้นทางแห่งวีรบุรุษ

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

title.native: 逃げ上手の若君 第二期

alternative: ながさき たかすけ

node.description: A manga artist known for creating Assassination Classroom and Majin Tantei Nougami Neuro. He was an assistant of Yoshio Sawai, the creator of Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo (Neuro's Shirota Masakage made a cameo appearance in Shinsetsu Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo). He provided the voice of the mangaka in episode 25 of the Majin Tantei Nougami Neuro anime.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kafunsyokougun)

Animation Producer at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Started his career at [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) as a production assistant on several series, already demonstrating his great penchant for scouting and fostering new talents. His first major role on an anime was as Production Desk on [Engaged to the Unidentified](https://anilist.co/anime/20483/) in 2014.

He left Doga Kobo in 2017 and joined [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/), later landing at CloverWorks after the studio became independent.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/haaagin) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/87_hagi)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). Debuted as a character designer on [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/).
Director of the Finishing Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).

[Website](https://highkick.jp/tateyama)

He is a drummer for the Japanese rock band THE LINDA!, which was formed in 2002 when its members were enrolled at Rikkyo University.
